result.execSummary:
The defendant Juanita Rose Sigman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Submit DNA sample (if not already done) and pay surcharge.
***Bond of $750.00 on file has been applied and balance is to be returned to the poster.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juanita Rose Sigman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Juanita Rose Sigman in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Cohen agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.  
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Cohen makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Cohen states that his client has already submitted a DNA sample
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 1 year Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $268.00
  DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $250.00 Surcharge
Bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Return date on July 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juanita Rose Sigman in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided.  Atty Cohen states that an offer was given; the defendant has an open case in Columbia County as well and would like that case to be done before this case.  Atty Cohen asks for a reset after June.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juanita Rose Sigman in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there has been some additional discussion but the parties are not at an agreement as of yet.  
Atty Cohen agrees but doesn't feel that trial is needed; he asks for a return.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Cohen states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return.
bond continued.

Defendant Juanita Rose Sigman in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Cohen states that he was just hired by the defendant and asks for a little time to look over the criminal complaint.
BY THE COURT:  Recess

Back on the record:
  Atty Cohen states that the defendant will waive the Preliminary Hearing and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
  Return date scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juanita Rose Sigman in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions defendant on her failure to have counsel here today.  Defendant states she thought her attorney was going to represent her.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will reset the preliminary hearing and defendant to contact her attorney to see if he will be representing her and file a notice of retainer.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Juanita Rose Sigman in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.   Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and states that she has an Attorney. Atty Hendee states that the defendant is out on bond from Columbia County.  Atty Hendee requests a $750 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $750 cash bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

Court questions the defendant regarding the time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant waives the time limits.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived for the Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
